laboratory_examinations.findings: 77 mg/L (normal, <27 mg/L); increased to 423 mg/L after TRH administration.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Postoperatively, PRL levels normalized to 27 mg/L, 17 mg/L, and 10 mg/L on the first, second, and third postoperative days.

laboratory_examinations.findings: GH peak: 7.5 mg/L; cortisol peak: 568 nmol/L.
PRL: 84 mg/L; plasma cortisol: 35 nmol/L; LH, FSH (<1 mIU/L); GH (0.1 mg/L).
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Postoperative MRI showed significant resolution of the lesion; persistent anterior pituitary failure requiring hormone replacement.

laboratory_examinations.findings: 1.9 cm sellar mass with suprasellar extension.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: MRI 3 months after steroid treatment showed complete resolution of the pituitary lesion.

laboratory_examinations.findings: 1 cm inhomogeneous lesion, bright on T1 and T2-weighted images.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Two years later, the lesion size did not regress on repeat MRI.
Two years later, normal levels (10 mg/L) and regular menstrual function maintained.
